byline.contributor: Carlotta Gall contributed reporting from Bayeux, France, and Farah Samti from Tunis.

abstract: Nobel committee awards Nobel Peace Prize to National Dialogue Quartet, Tunisian coalition made up of labor union leaders, businesspeople, lawyers and human rights activists; praises coalition for its efforts to help build pluralistic democracy in wake of country's 2011 revolution.
lead_paragraph: The coalition helped Tunisia through unrest in 2013 that threatened to undo an Islamist-led government.

headline.main: Nobel Peace Prize Is Awarded to National Dialogue Quartet in Tunisia
headline.print_headline: Peace Prize Goes to Tunisian Group for Backing Democracy After Arab Spring

snippet: The coalition helped Tunisia through unrest in 2013 that threatened to undo an Islamist-led government.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
